collation

Collationner: comparer et noter les différences entre deux états génétiques ou deux versions imprimées d’un texte.

(missing reference) 242

contributed by wout – last updated on 29-01-2015, by wout.

**Kollation **(lat. collatio ‘Zusammentragen’) Vergleich von Texten verschiedner Textträger um Übereinstimmungen und Abweichungen eines Textes zu ermitteln.

(missing reference) 137

contributed by wout – last updated on 29-01-2015, by wout.

Collation. Character-by-character comparison of two or more texts. Traditionally, the process by which editors isolate patterns of error that indicate transcriptional descent, to determine whether one or more texts is a copy made from an earlier and thus more reliable copy. Some twentieth-century editors have used the term to describe the process of visual comparison by which transcriptions, galleys, etc. are checked for error. With modern technology, the “compare” function in word-processing software performs this function by comparing the machine-readable versions of galleys and page proofs against each other.

(missing reference) 270

contributed by wout – last updated on 29-01-2015, by wout.

Collazione.

La seconda operazione che porta all’edizione critica, successiva alla ricognizione dei testimoni, è la loro collazione. Essa consiste nel confronto (così etimologicamente: collatio, dal latino confero) di ciascun testimone con gli altri, al fine di rilevarne le differenze.

(missing reference) 48

contributed by elisa – last updated on 29-01-2015, by wout.
